page.title: 03A Whitby Fisherman's Week.
page.content: My dad, Peter Leadley, is Skipper of{ "The Success", a large{trawler}with a crew of five. On Sunday night at about 8.00 p.m. when it's high tide, he sets off from the harbour until he's about ten miles from Whitby.Then he puts the nets down and{drifts}for fish.He pulls the nets up and puts the catch into ice boxes. He stays awake while the crew sleep until it's someone else's shift.In the morning, five miles from Sandsend, he puts the nets out again.He has something to eat and then drifts another three miles to net more fish. Later, he heads for home because the ice boxes should be full.He arrives home on Tuesday morning when the fish are off-loaded, weighed and the fuel tanks re-filled.He sails off again, further this time and returns on Friday and pays the crew.
